measured_by: observable Go / Stay behavioural outcome (turning before vs. after the AV)
justification: The Methods section states that “the decision outcome in each trial (Go or Stay) [was] determined based on whether the participant drove through the intersection before or after the AV,” indicating the construct of gap-acceptance was operationalised via the binary behavioural outcome.

measured_by: elapsed time from AV appearance to first accelerator-pedal press (for Go) or dedicated Stay-button press
justification: Under Measures the authors explain that response time was “the time the participant took to arrive to that decision… For Go decisions, … marked by the onset of the first accelerator pedal press… For Stay decisions, … participants [pressed] a button on a steering wheel as soon as they decided to Stay.”

measured_by: press of steering-wheel ‘negative rating’ button during trial
justification: The Methods note that participants were asked “to press a ‘negative rating’ button on the steering wheel ‘at any time when the AV behavior is confusing, weird, or unintuitive’,” making the button press the instrument for capturing negative subjective reactions.
construct: Subjective negative reaction to AV behaviour
